value.title: Model data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Connect Power BI to multiple data sources to create reports. Define the relationship between your data sources.

value.title: Append and Merge Tables in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to quickly merge and append tables using the query editior in Power BI. Build models with multiple data sources. Contact me on LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/gaelimholland

value.title: #1 DAX Fridays! 101: The basics of the DAX Language
value.excerpt: In today's video I want to go through the basics of DAX and explain basic pitfalls that you will fall into if you come from excel or are a business user. #daxfridays #dax #curbal   Have a great Friday!  Calculated column vs measure video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SmXLgEHXSGc  Vertipag (DAX engine

value.title: DAX Fridays! #10: RANK/ TOPN with slicer
value.excerpt: In this video you will learn how to create a custom slicer that will rank your data based on the criteria that you specify, for example, Top 3, Top 5 and Top 10. value.title: DAX Fridays! #41: LOOKUPVALUE with multiple columns
value.excerpt: In todays DAX Friday video, we will learn how to use the DAX Function called LOOKUPVALUE: Lookupvalue is very similar to excel's VLookup but there are some critical differences that you need to understand if you want to use it. We will have two scenarios,: Scenario 1: we will do a lookupvalue with two

value.title: DAX Fridays! #78: When should I use FILTER() with CALCULATE?
value.excerpt: When should you use the filter function with CALCULATE?  As you probably have noticed, sometimes people use a column in the filter part of CALCULATE and sometimes they use the FILTER function.  The question is, when should you use what?  In this video I will try to clarify that question.  Dont miss part

value.title: A TWIST on dynamically filtering visuals by a slicer in Power BI
value.excerpt: Here's a twist on dynamically filtering visuals by a slicer in Power BI! You can't use a measure directly in a slicer, so here's a way to get a similar experience and maintain usability of your reports.  Scott Sewell: https://twitter.com/scottsewell  BI Elite Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AZAL-QPn5Zc
